channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Opinion: 'YER OUT!' Eric Adams' fashion faux pas
item.description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams, no stranger to controversy, has ignited another with a hat. NPR's Scott Simon explains.
item.content:encoded:
New York City Mayor Eric Adams, no stranger to controversy, has ignited another with a hat. NPR's Scott Simon explains.

(Image credit: Frank Franklin II)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: Medicaid will cover traditional healing practices for Native Americans in 4 states
item.description: The new coverage includes practices such as music therapy, sweat lodges, and drumming, which are integral to Native healing traditions and have proved helpful for addiction among other health issues.
item.content:encoded:
The new coverage includes practices such as music therapy, sweat lodges, and drumming, which are integral to Native healing traditions and have proved helpful for addiction among other health issues.

(Image credit: San Francisco Chronicle/Hearst Newspapers)
item.dc:creator: Lesley McClurg

item.title: Trump is promising deportations under the Alien Enemies Act of 1798. What is it?
item.description: Former President Donald Trump says if reelected, he will invoke a centuries-old law to expedite the removal of undocumented immigrants. Can he? Here's what to know about the Alien Enemies Act of 1798.
item.content:encoded:
Former President Donald Trump says if reelected, he will invoke a centuries-old law to expedite the removal of undocumented immigrants. Can he? Here's what to know about the Alien Enemies Act of 1798.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Japan's ruling party headquarters is attacked with firebombs and suspect is arrested
item.description: A man threw firebombs into the headquarters of Japan’s ruling party in Tokyo, then crashed his car into the fencing of the prime minister's residence, police said. There were no reported injuries.
item.content:encoded:
A man threw firebombs into the headquarters of Japan’s ruling party in Tokyo, then crashed his car into the fencing of the prime minister's residence, police said. There were no reported injuries.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Moldova accuses Russia of meddling ahead of its elections and an EU referendum
item.description: Moldovans will vote for a new president and on a constitutional amendment regarding its path to the EU. Both votes will take place amid accusations of Russian meddling, vote buying and disinformation.
item.content:encoded: Moldovans will vote for a new president and on a constitutional amendment regarding its path to the EU. Both votes will take place amid accusations of Russian meddling, vote buying and disinformation.
item.dc:creator: Will Baxter

item.title: GOP ads on transgender rights are dominating airwaves in the election's closing days
item.description: The ad spending, which includes at least $17 million by the Trump campaign, is part of a broader Republican strategy casting the Democratic Party as taking transgender rights to extremes.
item.content:encoded:
The ad spending, which includes at least $17 million by the Trump campaign, is part of a broader Republican strategy casting the Democratic Party as taking transgender rights to extremes.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Susan Davis

item.title: U.S. to probe Tesla's 'Full Self-Driving' system after pedestrian killed
item.description: The U.S. government's road safety agency is investigating Tesla's “Full Self-Driving” system after getting reports of crashes in low-visibility conditions, including one that killed a pedestrian.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. government's road safety agency is investigating Tesla's “Full Self-Driving” system after getting reports of crashes in low-visibility conditions, including one that killed a pedestrian.

(Image credit: Michel Euler)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Harris and Trump hold competing rallies in Michigan
item.description: While the two candidates have been crisscrossing the swing states for weeks, this is the first time they are literally crossing paths, with each of them holding events in the suburbs north of Detroit.
item.content:encoded:
While the two candidates have been crisscrossing the swing states for weeks, this is the first time they are literally crossing paths, with each of them holding events in the suburbs north of Detroit.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Don Gonyea

item.title: Kentucky TikTok suit says company considered using Ky. creators to sway Sen. Mitch McConnell
item.description: The suit says videos by Kentucky small businesses were identified as possibly of interest to the senator, who has expressed concern about the app's effect on kids
item.content:encoded:
The suit says videos by Kentucky small businesses were identified as possibly of interest to the senator, who has expressed concern about the app's effect on kids

(Image credit: J. Scott Applewhite; Matt Slocum)
item.dc:creator: Sylvia Goodman

item.title: Cuba plunged into an island wide blackout as power grid fails
item.description: Cuban government declares an "energy emergency" after the failure of one of its few power plants plunges it into an island wide blackout.
item.content:encoded:
Cuban government declares an "energy emergency" after the failure of one of its few power plants plunges it into an island wide blackout.

(Image credit: Ramon Espinosa)
item.dc:creator: Emily Green
